sys::MutexAttr Class Reference
Inheritance diagram for sys::MutexAttr:

Documentation

The MutexAttr class manages a pthread_mutexattr_t object.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

sys::MutexAttr::MutexAttr ( )

Constructs a Mutex attributes object with default values.

sys::MutexAttr::MutexAttr ( const pthread_mutexattr_t &  mutexattr)
inline

Constructs a Mutex attributes object using the specified attributes.

sys::MutexAttr::MutexAttr ( enum type  t,
int  prio_ceiling = 0,
bool  pshared = false 
)

Constructs a mutex attributs object with the specified values.

Parameters
tMutex type (NORMAL or RECURSIVE)
prio_ceilingThe priority ceiling (0 is default, lowest priority)
psharedTrue if mutex is to be shared between processes

Returns the priority ceiling.

int sys::MutexAttr::get_protocol ( ) const

Returns the protocol.

bool sys::MutexAttr::get_pshared ( ) const

Returns true if the mutex attributes are for process sharing.

Returns the type.

Sets the priority ceiling.

Parameters
ceilingThe priority ceiling of the mutex
Returns
Zero on success

Sets the protocol.

Sets whether this is shared between processes.
